summary: React app appears to have removed the global custom cursor overlay and associated CSS, and the standalone landing page script/styles appear to have removed custom-cursor initialization/styling. However, the diff also includes broader unrelated UI/theme/app-structure changes beyond cursor behavior.

hallucinated_features.description: Broader React app layout/routing/provider setup changes not requested as part of cursor removal.
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest scope is limited to removing the custom cursor and restoring system cursor behavior; App-level restructuring is not requested and may constitute a UI/architecture change beyond cursor behavior.

hallucinated_features.description: Global design/theme token and typography overhaul (OKLCH palette, dark mode variables, typography utilities) beyond cursor behavior changes.
hallucinated_features.reason: Non-goal states not to redesign UI/branding beyond cursor behavior changes; extensive changes to global styling tokens indicate a wider redesign rather than just removing `cursor: none` / cursor overlay styles.

hallucinated_features.description: Large standalone landing page content/styling work beyond cursor removal (full stylesheet and content-driven JS structure shown).
hallucinated_features.reason: REQ-30 only asks to remove custom cursor behavior while keeping existing standalone interactions working; the diff summary indicates a complete standalone CSS/JS implementation with broad styling/content changes, which is outside the requested cursor-only scope.
